email_plci_title: FREE SUPPLEMENTARY PENSION FOR THE SELF-EMPLOYED (PLCI/VAPZ)
email_plci_p1: The PLCI/VAPZ (Free Supplementary Pension for the Self-Employed) is a savings solution that allows you to supplement your state pension while enjoying tax benefits. You contribute an amount and frequency of your choice (monthly, quarterly, semi-annually, or annually), with a ceiling set at €4,000.44 in 2025. The premiums are deductible as professional expenses, reduce your social security contributions, and allow, under certain conditions, to obtain an advance for real estate projects. At maturity, the capital is taxed advantageously.
email_plci_p2: Additionally, you can pair your PLCI/VAPZ with a Guaranteed Income insurance for the self-employed, which compensates for loss of income in case of incapacity to work (illness or accident). It supplements the health insurance allowance, is tax-deductible, and is aimed at self-employed individuals under 57 domiciled in Belgium. The younger you subscribe, the more advantageous it is.
email_plci_p3: The offer request for your Free Supplementary Pension for the Self-Employed will be handled during your next appointment.
email_inami_p1: The INAMI/RIZIV Plan is a scheme for healthcare providers who adhere to the convention. The INAMI/RIZIV contribution is an annual allowance granted by INAMI/RIZIV in return for respecting the convention tariffs. It must be invested in a supplementary pension plan with a social character, and may also include disability cover that protects the self-employed person in case of illness or accident.
email_inami_p2: The amount of the contribution varies depending on the profession and situation (e.g., new doctor, intern, etc.).
email_inami_p3: The offer request and simulation for your INAMI/RIZIV Plan will be handled during your next appointment.
email_eip_p1: The EIP/IPT (Individual Pension Commitment) is a pension savings solution for company directors. It is a flexible non-statutory benefit that adapts to your needs and situation. You can deduct 100% of the contributions you pay into your EIP/IPT as a professional expense, provided you respect the 80.00% rule.
email_eip_p2: The 80.00% rule sets a maximum for your deductible pension savings. Here’s how it works:
email_eip_li_1: The sum of your state pension and your supplementary pension savings (like the EIP/IPT) cannot exceed 80% of your average gross annual salary.
email_eip_li_2: Your gross salary includes not only your monthly salary but also any benefits you receive (like a company car).
email_eip_p3: If you respect this rule, you can benefit from a tax advantage while building a comfortable retirement. Additionally, the premiums allow, under certain conditions, to obtain an advance for real estate projects. At maturity, the capital is taxed advantageously.
email_eip_p4: Furthermore, you can pair your EIP/IPT with a Guaranteed Income insurance for the self-employed, which compensates for loss of income in case of incapacity to work (illness or accident). It supplements the health insurance allowance, is tax-deductible, and is aimed at self-employed individuals under 57 domiciled in Belgium. The younger you subscribe, the more advantageous it is.
email_eip_p5: The offer request and simulation for your Individual Pension Commitment will be handled during your next appointment.
